boat.name: Nercissa
boat.full_description:
'Nercissa' is believed to be a fishing boat with a two-masted lug rig, decked from the stem to the mainmast, probably working in the Plymouth area when built.

She moved to Ramsgate in 1928, was changed to a sloop and had an engine fitted. She was later owned by a Mr C Corrie of Rochester. She laid derelict with the tide running through her for nearly seven years in Blue Boar Creek before she was rescued by Mr J Harding in 1956 who managed to get her afloat and partially converted to a yacht.

After being purchased by R.A. Rush she had a major restoration, replacing the deck, coach roof and transom. He re-engined her and re-rigged her as a gaff cutter and got her sailing again in July 1970.

She had another new engine in 1997 and was sold to Steve Finch in 2011, since when she has been out of the water for a major overhaul.
boat.construction_details: Pitch pine carvel planking on sawn oak frames, iron fastened
boat.short_description: 'Nercissa' has been out of the water since 2011 for a major overhaul. Some of her earlier history is known since her origins in Plymouth as a fishing boat.
